byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and BEN PROTESS

abstract: Justice Department puts forth policies aimed at prosecuting individuals at Wall Street companies, and not just their employers, in seeking to address situation that allowed many perpetrators of housing crisis, financial meltdowns and corporate scandals to go unpunished; move, first major policy announcement by Atty Gen Loretta E Lynch, acknowledges that fines levied against corporations have not gone far enough in seeking justice and bolstering public trust in regulatory authorities.
lead_paragraph: New policies prioritize the prosecution of individual employees and put pressure on corporations to turn over evidence against their executives.

headline.main: Justice Department Sets Sights on Wall Street Executives
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Sets Its Sights on Executives

snippet: New policies prioritize the prosecution of individual employees and put pressure on corporations to turn over evidence against their executives.
